sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Desmond Tutu, South Africa's Nobel Peace Prize winning activist for racial justice, has died aged 90.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Reverend Tutu is best known for his campaigns against South Africa's apartheid racial segregation system, consistently arguing for non-violent opposition to the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He also spoke out against the post-apartheid ANC government, poverty, the occupation in the West Bank and the church's attitude to homosexuality. Mr Tutu, who was also the retired Anglican Archbishop of Cape Town, had been hospitalized several times since 2015 after being diagnosed with cancer in 1997.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: World leaders spoke in a series of Christmas messages, mentioning another difficult year fighting COVID-19, grieving for loss of loved ones and praising soldiers stationed abroad Desmond Tutu South Africa's Nobel Peace Prize winning activist for racial justice has died aged 90 Reverend Tutu is best known for his campaigns against South Africa's apartheid racial segregation system consistently arguing for nonviolent opposition to the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He also spoke out against the post-apartheid ANC government, poverty, the occupation in the West Bank, and the church's attitude to homosexuality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Mr. Tutu, who is also the retired Anglican Archbishop of Cape Town, had been hospitalized several times since 2015, after being diagnosed with cancer in 1997.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Backed by the central band of the Royal British Legion, Queen Elizabeth II empathised with those mourning loved ones at Christmas, while paying tribute to her late husband, Prince Philip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Although it's a time of great happiness and good cheer for many, Christmas can be hard for those who have lost loved ones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This year especially, I understand why.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But for me, in the months since the death of my beloved Philip, I have drawn great comfort from the warmth and affection of the many tributes to his life and work, from around the country, the Commonwealth and the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Germany, President Frank-Walter Steinmeier used his message to warn against the division of society since the start of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He said, we feel that after two years, frustration, irritation, polarisation and unfortunately also ostensible aggressiveness are setting in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's true that in a democracy we don't all have to agree.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But let us not forget that we are one country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We must be able to look at each other in the eye even after the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hi, Merry Christmas. How are you?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: US President and First Lady Joe and Jill Biden thanked US troops abroad in their messages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You're the solid steel spine of the nation. You really are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Always vigilant, always ready when duty calls 365 days a year and during the holiday season as we pray for peace and spread joy and glad tidings we also look for hope toward the possibility of a better year and to give thanks and give thanks to everything for everything we've got to Bethlehem's Church of the Nativity held a slightly

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: subdued morning service on Saturday, celebrating the second Christmas under the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It was led by Patriarch Pier Battista Pizzaballa, the top Catholic clergyman in the Holy Land and it was attended by hundreds of churchgoers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In pre-pandemic times, thousands of pilgrims and tourists from around the world celebrated in the church and the adjacent manger square.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: After three months of spewing lava, the volcano on the island of La Palma has finally been declared inactive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It has destroyed 3,000 buildings, cut off roads and wrecked farms and vineyards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thankfully, no one was injured or killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The volcano went quiet on December 13th, and after 10 days without activity, volcanologists declared it inactive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The scientific and technical rigour and the precedence of the historical eruptions in the Canary Islands made it necessary to establish a period of caution until we could say what I am saying today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The eruption is over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez called the eruption's end the best Christmas present.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The loss of buildings and infrastructure is estimated to have cost more than 900 million euros. But Sanchez tweeted that the damage would be repaired. The world's most powerful space telescope blasts off into orbit, headed to an outpost

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: 1.5 million kilometres from Earth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The James Webb Space Telescope was taken up by the Ariane 5 rocket from the Kourou Space Centre in French Guiana on Christmas Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It now has to travel a distance four times as far as the Moon, and it will take a month to get there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And after another five months, its infrared eyes will be ready to start scanning the cosmos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: First, the telescope's enormous mirror and sunshield had to unfurl.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They'd been folded origami-style into the rocket's cone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Webb will observe a part of space and time never seen before, providing a wealth of amazing views into an era when the very first stars and galaxies formed, over 13.5 billion years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The project is a collaboration between the European Space Agency, the Canadian Space Agency and NASA, who named the telescope after a former director.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: British police arrested a man on Saturday after a security breach at Windsor Castle, where the Queen was celebrating Christmas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They said he was carrying an offensive weapon and that he entered the grounds at 8.30 in the morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The authorities also added that security processes were triggered within moments of the man entering the grounds and that he did not enter any buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Members of the royal family have been informed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the center of Tbilisi there is a place where the past has been brought back to life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All personal belongings are being sold here and they bring back the memories of Soviet empire, which lasted for 70 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There will always be a customer looking for a portrait bust of Stalin, Soviet passports and military decorations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For some, these are just quirky and fashionable collectibles, but for others, they bring back horrific memories, which will hopefully never take place again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For some, these symbols represent the joys of young life, when food was plenty and if lucky one could secure a free vacation as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There was nothing, no economy. If you wanted to buy anything you had to go to Moscow and bring it back all the way from there. Some do feel nostalgic about the Soviet times, more or less due to the stability at the time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We were socially secure, everything was available, ability to travel, high salaries and employment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On the streets of Tbilisi, here and there, one can still find different examples of Soviet symbols, the infamous hammer and sickle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Though for the younger generations these symbols are merely objects of interest, they are too young to remember the realities of Soviet times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Most importantly, the Soviet Union reminds us that it was a terrorist state, a state which allowed its citizens no free political will, where freedom is out of question and banned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Soviet past still influences today's society in many ways. Old views and perceptions of life still shape the life of the young, and this is said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In 1991, it was proven that an involuntary bond of 15 states in the Soviet Union was not as unbreakable as once thought, and already disintegrating empire ruined thousands of lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But 30 years on, the Russian Federation still attempts to control its former colonies and describes those states as a part of its sphere of influence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin has stated that the dissolution of the Soviet Union was the biggest geopolitical catastrophe of the 20th century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now we witness Putin and his Russia attempting to declare the post-soviet states as a part of Moscow sphere of influence they somewhat came to terms with the fact that they lost the Baltics those states managed to make it in time and join the European Union in NATO however you see the amount of problems present in Georgia and Ukraine the Empire has taken a toll on people living in the Soviet Union, and the consequences often show themselves in their thoughts and actions even without realization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The political culture of the Russian Federation, of the other post-Soviet states that emerged as national states from it continued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A colleague of mine said very clearly, you can take Georgia out of the Soviet Union, but not the Soviet Union out of Georgia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Despite these struggles, the generation which looks forward the West with hope Georgia.
